title: 107_hr1826
content: The Act titled "Alternative Routes to Teacher Certification and Licensure Act of 2001" is reauthorized under the Higher Education Act of 1965, introducing a new title VIII focused on alternative routes to teacher certification and licensure. The Congress recognizes the importance of competent teachers and strong leadership in effective schools. Alternative routes to teacher certification can help increase the pool of qualified individuals and allow school systems to utilize the expertise of professionals from outside the education profession. Alternative routes to certification or licensure requirements can help school systems utilize professionals from outside the education profession and improve the supply of well-qualified teachers. The purpose of this title is to improve the supply of qualified teachers by encouraging alternative routes to teacher certification, with a focus on minority group participation. The Secretary shall allot funds to each State based on their population of children ages 5 through 17. Excess funds may be reallocated to States in need. Funds awarded under this title shall remain available. Funds awarded under the Education Provisions Act shall remain available for 2 calendar years from the grant date. SEC. 804. STATE APPLICATIONS. State applications for grants under this title must be submitted by the State educational agency, detailing programs and providing necessary assurances to the Secretary. These assurances include using funds to supplement, not supplant, existing state or local funds for teacher certification programs. The State educational agency must consult with various stakeholders, including local educational agencies, teachers, institutions of higher education, parents, and other organizations, when developing grant applications under this title. The State educational agency must consult stakeholders when developing grant applications under this title. A final report on activities and results must be submitted to the Secretary. GEPA provisions do not apply, except for fiscal control and fund accounting procedures. "SEC. 805. USE OF FUNDS." A State educational agency must use funds to support programs that help individuals transition to a career in education through alternative routes to teacher certification. Funds can be used for program design, development, implementation, and evaluation. The evaluation of programs for qualified professionals entering the education profession through alternative routes, establishment of administrative structures, staff training, recruitment strategies, and development of reciprocity agreements. The curr_chunk discusses the development of reciprocity agreements between states for teacher certification or licensure, along with other programs to meet the objectives of this title. Authorization of appropriations of $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2002 and the following three years is provided to carry out the objectives of this title.
